gurmukhi: ਦਰਸੋ ਸੁਨਿ ਜੂਝੈ ਤਿਨੈ ਬਹੁਤ ਜੁਝਤ ਭਯੋ ਅਾੲਿ ॥੫੭॥
transliteration: Darso Soun(i) Joojhai Tinai Bahout Jujhat Bhayo Aae||57||
translation: When Darsho came to know of it, he also came in the field and died. 57.

gurmukhi: ਹਿੰਮਤ ਹੂੰ ੳੁਤਰਿਯੋ ਤਹਾ ਬੀਰ ਖੇਤ ਮੰਝਾਰ ॥
transliteration: Hinmat Hoon Outariyo Tahaa Boor Khet Manjhaar||
translation: Then Himmat came in the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਕੇਤਨ ਕੇ ਤਨਿ ਘਾੲਿ ਸਹਿ ਕੇਤਨਿ ਕੈ ਤਨਿ ਝਾਰ ॥੫੮॥
transliteration: Ketan Ke Tan(i) Ghaae Sah(i) Ketan(i) Kai Tan(i) Jhaar||58||
translation: He received several wounds and struck his weapons on several others.58.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜ ਤਹਾਂ ਜੂਝਤ ਭਯੋ ਹਿੰਮਤ ਗਯੋ ਪਰਾੲਿ ॥
transliteration: Baaj Tahaan Joojhat Bhayo Hinmat Gado Paraae||
translation: His horse was killed there, but Himmat fled.

gurmukhi: ਲੋਥ ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾਲਹਿ ਕੀ ਨਮਿਤ ਕੋਪਿ ਪਰੇ ਅਰਰਾੲਿ ॥੫੯॥
transliteration: Loth Kridaalah(i) Koo Namit Kop(i) Dare Ar-raae||59||
translation: The warriors of Katoch came with great rage in order ot take away the dead body of their Raja Kirpal.59.

gurmukhi: ਬਲੀ ਬੈਰ ਰੁੱਝੇ ॥ ਸਮੁਹਿ ਸਾਰ ਜੁੱਝੇ ॥
transliteration: Badoo Bair Rujjhe|| Samuh(i) Saar Jujjhe||
translation: The warriors are busy in wreaking vengeance, they become martyrs facing the sword.

gurmukhi: ਕ੍ਰਿਪਾ ਰਾਮ ਗਾਜੀ ॥ ਲਰਿਓ ਸੈਨ ਭਾਜੀ ॥੬੦॥
transliteration: Kridaa Raam Gadjoo|| Lario Sain Bhaajoo||60||
translation: The warrior Kirpa Ram fought so severely that all the army seems running away. 60.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾ ਸੈਨ ਗਾਹੈਂ ॥ ਨ੍ਰਿਭੈ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਬਾਹੈਂ ॥
transliteration: Mahaa Sain Gadhain|| Nribhai Sastra Baahain||
translation: He tramples the big army and strikes his weapon fearlessly.

gurmukhi: ਘਨਿਯੋ ਕਾਲ ਕੈ ਕੈ ॥ ਚਲੈ ਜੱਸ ਲੈ ਕੈ ॥੬੧॥
transliteration: Ghaniyo Kaal Kai Kai|| Chalai Jass Lai Kai||61||
translation: After destroying many and receiving approbation, he hath left.61.
The conches and trumpets resound and their sound is heard constantly.

gurmukhi: ਬਜੇ ਡੌਰ ਡੱਢੰ ॥ ਹਠੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਕੱਢੰ ॥੬੨॥
transliteration: Bade Daur Daddhan|| Hathe Sastra Kaddhan||62||
translation: The tabors and drums resound and the warriors are taking out their weapons.62.

gurmukhi: ਪਰੀ ਭੀਰ ਭਾਰੀ ॥ ਜੁਝੈ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਧਾਰੀ ॥
transliteration: Daroo Bhoor Bhdaroo|| Jujhai Chhatra Dhdaroo||
translation: There is overcrowding and the kings have fallen as martyrs.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਖੰ ਮੁੱਛ ਬੰਕੰ ॥ ਮੰਡੇ ਬੀਰ ਹੰਕੰ ॥੬੩॥
translation: The warriors on whose faces there are winsome whiskers, they are shouting very loudly.63.
